channel.title: Notes on llesha
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on llesha

item.title: Eye focus and main eye
item.description: On sketches that illustrate eye focus, it is shown that humans, when looking straight ahead, focus their vision at a point between their eyes. I came to the conclusion that it is not true, and we focus similarly to the picture on the right. I have a small experimental proof for it. Look in the mirror. What point are you looking at most of the time? For me, it is the right eye.
